SENT.plain: Klippel-Trenaunay (KT) or as it is also called Klippel-Trenaunay-Weber (KTW) syndrome is a rare congenital phacomatosis of uncertain aetiology and variable expression

The classical syndrome is a triad of congenital mesodermal abnormalities characterized by cutaneous angiomatous nevus commonly called port-wine stain, venous varicosities and hypertrophy of soft tissue and/or overgrowth of bone of one or more limbs

Clinically, a diversity of phenotypes with subjacent malformations may be encountered all having in common abnormalities of the mesoblastic sheets that include angioblastic, lymphoblastic and osteoblastic lineages
Each of them may give rise to malformations that may exist alone or in an unlimited diversity of associations
We present three widely different clinical expressions of this syndrome and we support the proposal to group all these malformations under the eponym of Klippel-Trenaunay-Type (KTT) syndrome
